tool.name: Taxonomy-to-Krona
tool.description: convert a mothur taxonomy file to Krona input format
tool.command: cat $inputfile | tail -n +2 ## remove header line | cut -f2,3 ## remove first column | sed 's/;/\t/g' ## split taxonomy field on semicolon | sed 's/"//g' ## remove quotation marks | sed 's/[ \t]*$//' ## remove trailing whitespace #if $stripconfidences | sed -r 's/[(][0-9]+[)]//g' ## remove confidence scores #end if > $outputfile

param.name: inputfile
param.label: Taxonomy file
param.help: Mothur-formatted taxonomy file. Should have 3 columns; OTU-size-taxonomy

param.name: stripconfidences
param.label: Strip confidence values?
param.help: Strip the confidence values enclosed in parentheses behind the taxonomy levels if present. e.g. Bacteria(100);Bacteroidetes(87);..

tool.help:
Krona text input requires a tab-delimited file with first column being a count, and the rest representing the hierarchy, for example::
2 Fats Saturated fat 3 Fats Unsaturated fat Monounsaturated fat 3 Fats Unsaturated fat Polyunsaturated fat 13 Carbohydrates Sugars 4 Carbohydrates Dietary fiber 21 Carbohydrates 5 Protein 4
This can be input into the Krona tool as generic text format, and would yield this `Krona plot`_.
.. _Krona plot: https://marbl.github.io/Krona/examples/xml.krona.html
